Description: Rim and body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery lidless lekanis with root of handle on right; interior glazed streaky black with added red band at junction with bowl; top of rim glazed; exterior: black band below rim; below, black-figure decoration consisting of part of wing, possibly from a siren, with red band, to left; incised blob rosettes as filling ornament; to right, part of handle palmette complex.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 337, no. B399)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0773) (Phase 1)
